main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted by a military officer near St. Louis, Missouri on November 1, 1956.
interesting points: The object was a round light, about the size of an F-94 aircraft, observed at an altitude of 15,000 to 20,000 feet traveling at approximately 3,000 mph., The sighting lasted about 2 minutes with visibility calculated at over 60 miles., The object was bright and solid color without any visible tail., An experienced pilot noted that the object's speed was much greater than surrounding jet aircraft., The object suddenly disappeared as if its light turned off.
sighted object: a round light in the sky
witness description: Captain Daniel, Aerial Weather Reconnaissance Officer with substantial flying experience.
